business.headline: Will Donald Trump's tariff suspense hurt Indian stocks? All you need to knowDonald Trump has also threatened BRICS nations with up to 100% tariffs against taking a decision that could lead to de-dollarisation of the global economy.

Budget 2025: 3 things government should focus on to tackle climate changeBudget 2025 expectations: Experts said climate action is the need of the hour and announcements related to clean energy will be crucial. There could be a push to boost green jobs as well.

Explained: Why ICICI Prudential shares tumbled 10% after Q3 resultsICICI Prudential share price: The company's share price decline came a day after Q3FY25 results, where it reported a 43% rise in net profit to Rs 326 crore.

Zomato shares down over 23% in a month. Should you buy or avoid?Zomato share price: The food delivery giant's stock price has fallen over 14% in the previous two sessions and over 23% in the past month.

Denta Water IPO opens for bidding: Should you subscribe? Check latest GMPDenta Water and Infra Solutions IPO: The price band for the IPO of Denta Water has been set at Rs 279-294 per share with retail investors required to invest a minimum of Rs 14,700. The minimum lot size for an application is 50.

Sensex, Nifty open higher driven by a rally in IT sector stocks; Wipro gains 2%The S&P BSE Sensex was up 246.41 points to 76,084.77, while the NSE Nifty50 added 62.15 points to 23,086.80 as of 9:26 AM.

HDFC Bank to announce Q3 results today: Here's what to expectHDFC Bank Q3 FY25 Results Expectations: Investors will be keeping a keen eye on the results as the stock of HDFC Bank has fallen 8.62% in the last month.

Budget 2025: Raghuram Rajan says tax cuts won't solve India's fiscal problemsFormer RBI Governor Raghuram Rajan said that he is not worried about the reduction in tax rates but instead about the need for more effective government spending, particularly in human capital development.

Stocks to watch today: HCLTech, HDFC Bank, HUL, Tata Communication, ZomatoHDFC Bank, Hindustan Unilever (HUL), and Tata Communication will be announcing their Q3 FY25 results today, hence their stocks will likely see some action.

Ex-RBI Governor Raghuram Rajan speaks on Trump's tariffs, job creation and othersFormer RBI Governor Raghuram Rajan highlighted his views on issues like US President Donald Trump's plans to impose tariffs on some countries, including India, and how the economy and job creation is progressing under the Narendra Modi-led central government.

Concern for world, won't benefit US much: Raghuram Rajan on Trump tariff threatSpeaking to India Today TV, former RBI Governor Raghuram Rajan warned that US President Donald Trump's tariff plans could harm global economic stability, increase costs, and deter foreign investment.
A decade of budget evolution under ModiCoalition dynamics could influence future budgetary decisions, particularly in the welfare sector. Will the government maintain its current priorities?

What to expect from Budget 2025: Growth, taxes, and fiscal realities in numbersFY25's deficit is projected at 4.9 per cent of the GDP, or Rs 16.1 trillion. Despite slower economic growth, the government is expected to stick to its fiscal discipline plan.

IMF's Gita Gopinath on Trump tariffs, impact on global growth, AI and moreDuring the interview, Gita Gopinath discussed the potential impact of US President Donald Trump's plan to impose new trade tariffs, global growth, bilateral trade between India and America, cryptocurrency and more.

IMF's Gita Gopinath suggests India to lower tariffs and focus on domestic reformsGita Gopinath suggested that India should consider lowering its tariffs, not only to counter the tariff concerns raised by former US President Donald Trump, but also to boost its own economic growth.

Sensex, Nifty crash: Bears dominate amid Trump's tariff threat; Zomato down 11%Share Market Crash: The S&P BSE Sensex plunged 1235.08 points to close at 75,838.36, while the NSE Nifty50 was down 320.10 points to end at 23,024.65.

Sensex crashes as Trump 2.0 spooks D-Street investors. 3 things to knowStock market crash: The Sensex tumbled 1,300 points to 75,773 at around 2:45 pm, while the Nifty50 fell below 23,000. All other broader market indices also collapsed during the trading session.

India could afford to cut back...: IMF's Gita Gopinath on Trump tariff threatGita Gopinath said that India's focus should be on domestic reforms rather than tariff battles as it looks to become a global hub for manufacturing.

Anshuman Mishra shares insights on Donald Trump's second term inaugurationInvestment banker and political strategist Anshuman Mishra provides exclusive insights from Washington DC on Donald Trump's second term inauguration.

Donald Trump's uncertain tariff plan keeps Dalal Street on edge. 3 key takeawaysUS President Donald Trump has decided not to immediately implement tariffs, leading to uncertainty among market investors around the world, including Dalal Street.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Arvind Kejriwal's 7 demands from Centre in AAP's 'middle class manifesto'AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal on Wednesday unveiled his party's manifesto for the upcoming Delhi elections, for the middle class, a section he claims has been ignored by successive governments.

We need great people to come to US: Trump weighs in on H-1B visa debateDonald Trump on H-1B visa: When asked about the H-1B visa debate at a press conference on Tuesday, President Trump said that "I like both sides of the argument, but I also like very competent people coming into our country, even if that involves them training and helping other people that may not have the qualifications they do".

Pataudi family may lose property worth Rs 15,000 crore after court orderOn December 13, 2024, the Madhya Pradesh High Court asked the Pataudi family to present their side before the appellate authority in 30 days. As of January 21, however, it was not clear whether the family did so.

Trudeau warns Trump against imposing tariffs, says US needs Canadian resourcesShortly after taking office on Monday, US President Donald Trump reiterated his threat to impose a 25 per cent tariff on Canadian and Mexican imports, starting as early as February 1, if the two neighbouring nations did not clamp down on illegal immigration.

Who is Shivon Zilis, Elon Musk's 'mystery partner' spotted at Trump's dinner?Elon Musk was accompanied by his 'mystery partner' at the pre-inauguration dinner of Donald Trump, making many wonder if he was making his relationship official with her. The woman is Shivon Zilis who shares three children with him.

BJP alleges Punjab employees installing Chinese CCTVs in Delhi, AAP hits backThe 70-member Delhi Assembly is scheduled to go to polls on February 5 and the results are set to be declared on February 8.

Saif Ali Khan's house lit up as actor returns home from hospitalAfter being discharged from the hospital on Tuesday, Saif Ali Khan received a grand welcome. Pictures of his Bandra home, illuminated and decorated, went viral.

Video: Trump in front, bishop's mercy appeal for the LGBTQ+, illegal immigrantsShortly after he took office, Trump announced that he would bring sweeping changes to the "gender identity" policy and also signed an executive order to launch an immediate crackdown on illegal immigration.

Nita Ambani flaunts ethnic glam in traditional sarees at Trump's inauguration eventsMukesh and Nita Ambani attended Donald Trump's Inauguration Day ceremonies in Washington, where the latter proudly showcased her Indian heritage through her sartorial choices.

Day 11 Live Updates: Shelton wins 2nd set vs Sonego, Swiatek, Keys through to semi-finalsAustralian Open Day 11 Live Updates: Ben Shelton has won the second set in his quarter-final clash against Lorenzo Sonego at the Rod Laver Arena. Earlier, Iga Swiatek sealed her spot in the semi-final after a thumping win over Emma Navarro in the quarter-final and Madison Keys completed a comeback win over Elina Svitolina. Jannik Sinner will take on Alex de Minaur later in the day.
11 dead after fruit truck overturns in KarnatakaA truck carrying fruits from Haveri to Kumta in Karnataka overturned in Uttara Kannada district, killing 11 people. It was carrying over 30 passengers.

Trump, Biden and the politics of presidential pardonsRooted in history that stretches back to Ancient Greece, Rome, and the English monarchy, the presidential pardon was envisioned by America's founding fathers as a mechanism to serve public welfare and dispense mercy.

Mumbai musician vibes to Air India track on flight. Airline reacts to videoMumbai-based musician Paresh Kamath couldn't stop vibing to the Air India track on his flight. The video has gone viral on social media.

Saif Ali Khan wanted to meet, thank help for her bravery after returning home: SourcesActor Saif Ali Khan returned home from hospital following two surgeries days after the stabbing incident. Sources tell India Today that the actor wanted to meet and thank house help Eliyamma Phillip for her bravery.

Trump places all federal diversity, equity, inclusion staff on paid leaveThe memo follows an executive order Trump signed on his first day ordering a sweeping dismantling of the federal government's diversity and inclusion programs that could touch on everything from anti-bias training to funding for minority farmers and homeowners.

Watch: Buttler gives autograph to fan on wheelchair ahead of T20I vs IndiaJos Buttler won hearts in Kolkata by signing a bat for specially abled Indian fan Dharamveer Pal, ahead of England's T20I opener against India, showcasing his connection with fans off the field.

S Jaishankar attends Quad meet, Trump 2.0's first; bilateral with Rubio, his firstExternal Affairs Minister S Jaishankar participated in the Quad Foreign Ministers' meeting in Washington DC, a day after Donald Trump's inauguration as the 47th US President.

Trump's Defence Secretary pick accused of abusing 2nd wifeRepublican leaders said they doubted the new allegations would change the votes of support they are lining up for Pete Hegseth. They marched ahead with the nomination on Tuesday evening, taking a key procedural step needed to confirm him by week's end.

Ramesh Bidhuri jabs Atishi again, says her parents backed terrorist Afzal GuruDelhi Assembly Elections 2025: BJP leader Ramesh Bidhuri, who is the BJP's candidate from Kalkaji for the Delhi Assembly elections, claimed that Delhi Chief Minister Atishi's parents wrote to the then President to stop the execution of Afzal Guru.

There was a sense of fear even while running: Shami recalls injury ordealIND vs ENG: Speedster Mohammed Shami talked about the challenges he faced while recovering from the injuries that kept him out of the national team since the ODI World Cup final against Australia in November 2023.

Must not harass people, take law into hands: High Court fines ED Rs 1 lakhThe Bombay High Court slapped a fine of Rs 1 lakh on the ED for initiating a money laundering probe against a real estate developer "without serious application of mind" and said such agencies should act within the purview of law.

Actor Aparna Vinod announces divorce, calls marriage 'emotionally draining' Malayalam actor Aparna Vinod announced the news of her divorce on social media. She shared that her marriage with Rinilraj PK was a difficult phase and decided to close that chapter.

Deva: Shahid Kapoor is ready for action in new still from Rosshan Andrrews' filmOn January 22, Shahid Kapoor released a new still from his upcoming film, Deva. Directed by Rosshan Andrrews, the film will release on January 31.

Video: Malavika Mohanan's fight scene from Prabhas's The Raja Saab leakedMalavika Mohanan's fight scene from Prabhas's upcoming film, The Raja Saab, has been leaked online. The video is now going viral on the Internet.

Under Niki, India have won both their matches and are placed on top of Group A.

With Mohammed Shami's return and Champions Trophy preparations in focus, India eyes redemption following their recent struggles against Australia.

Carlo Ancelotti breaks silence on his Real Madrid future: Not for me to decideReal Madrid head coach Carlo Ancelotti addressed his future at the La Liga club amid reports that he was planning to leave Madrid at the end of the season.

2nd T20I: Free metro travel announced for ticket holders in Chennai India vs England, 2nd T20I: The Tamil Nadu Cricket Association has announced free metro travel to and from the MA Chidambaram Stadium for ticket holders on Saturday, January 25.

Additional security for Rohit Sharma's first Ranji game in a decadeIndia skipper Rohit Sharma's Ranji Trophy comeback match for Mumbai will feature additional security and seating arrangements for up to 500 people.

Day 11 Order of Play: Jannik Sinner headlines second set of quarterfinalsThe 2025 Australian Open resumes on Wednesday, with top seed and defending champion Jannik Sinner leading the action in the second set of quarter-finals in Melbourne.

Carlos Alcaraz reveals biggest mistake in quarterfinal vs Novak DjokovicCarlos Alcaraz was knocked out of the Australian Open 2025 after losing to Novak Djokovic in the quarterfinal of the competition. Alcaraz reviewed his game and revealed his biggest mistake in the match.

Djokovic says beating Alcaraz 'huge win' for relationship with coach MurrayAustralian Open 2025: Novak Djokovic said his relationship with coach Andy Murray is getting better with every passing day and the win against Carlos Alcaraz in the quarterfinal will only help further the bond.

Australian Open: Murray consoles Carlos Alcaraz after loss vs Novak DjokovicNovak Djokovic's coach Andy Murray consoled young Carlos Alcaraz after the Spaniard was beaten in the quarter-finals of the Australian Open 2025. Alcaraz lost the quarters vs Djokovic despite winning the first set of the match.

Alcaraz lost the quarters vs Djokovic despite winning the first set of the match.

2 arms, 1.5 legs: How Djokovic battled injury to beat Alcaraz Australian Open 2025: Novak Djokovic talked about how he dealt with his leg injury during the match against Carlos Alcaraz on Tuesday. Djokovic lost the opening set before he made a comeback to book a berth in the semi-final of the hard court major.

Kids up till 1 am, Novak Djokovic interrupts interview for daddy duty Australian Open 2025: Novak Djokovic entertained on the court and off it on Tuesday, putting on a show against third seed Carlos Alcaraz. The Serb interrupted his on-court interview to have a heartwarming chat with his kids, who were at Rod Laver Arena.

No question mark over Samson as wicketkeeper in T20I side: Suryakumar India captain Suryakumar Yadav confirmed that Sanju Samson is the first-choice wicketkeeper in the T20I side with Dhruv Jurel being his backup. "Currently, there is no question mark on the wicketkeeper," Suryakumar told the reporters.

Hardik Pandya part of leadership group: Suryakumar Yadav on vice-captaincy snubSuryakumar Yadav has stressed that all-rounder Hardik Pandya is firmly a part of the leadership group. The India T20I captain has revealed his relationship with Pandya after the all-rounder was snubbed from the vice-captain's position for the England series.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
